subject: Re: JUnit & Reflection -  now Clean ClassLoader Environment for Tests.
msgSnippet: Hi Again Neil, Thanks for your help, I m not sure if this is overkill, this solution involves some other packages, the javaassist stuff from Jboss.org, my code
messageBody:
Hi Again Neil,

Thanks for your help, I'm not sure if this is overkill, this solution
involves some other packages, the javaassist stuff from Jboss.org, my
code involved simply getting the current Thread, and replacing the
current classloader (I assume this is possible through the
setContextClassLoader method on the Thread class), which took about 10
lines in the setUp() method of a test case.

Saying that, I can see the extra functionality (and flexibility) in
your code and have no doubt I'll be using it soon!

Thanks again!

Oisin


>
> I submitted a reloading classloader to the group files section if you're
> interested.
>
> - Neil Swingler
